âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Compiles shell scripts to static binaries â€¢ Transpiles shell scripts to Go code â€¢ Aims for bash compatibility â€¢ Provides improved error handling and messages
ðŸ“– Summary: Bunster is a shell compiler that converts bash scripts into Go code and then compiles them into static binaries. This allows the scripts to run in environments where a shell is not available, improving security and portability. Bunster aims to provide modern language features like improved error handling, a module system, and support for .env files.
